name: Thermodynamics
description: The study of energy in its many forms involves thermodynamic principles. Basic concepts of work, heat, properties of perfect gases and pure substances will be addressed. The first law of thermodynamics will be applied to practical systems like compressors, turbines, nozzles and others to implement the concept of energy conversion. Basic power cycles will be analysed and the performance merit to be determined. The various modes of heat transfer will be practiced and applied to simple situations. Cross-referenced to the National Technology Benchmarks (NTB).
prerequisites: At least 60% in English Language Arts 30-1 or English Language Arts 30-2
At least 60% in Math 30-1 or at least 75% in Math 30-2
At least 60% in Physics 20 and Chemistry 20, or at least 60% in Science 30

learningOutcomes.title: Explain the thermodynamic system and its properties
objectives: Explain the term thermodynamics, the thermodynamic system and its properties
Classify properties of a system
Classify thermodynamic systems
Explain the terms; state, equilibrium, thermodynamic process, thermodynamic cycles
Discuss different forms of energy
Describe methods of pressure and temperature measurements
State the zeroth law of thermodynamics
Specify temperature scales and conversion in International System of Units (SI) and imperial system of units

learningOutcomes.title: Calculate work, power, and heat transfer in a thermodynamic system
objectives: Calculate the total energy of a system
Calculate mechanical forms of work
Determine the power-work relationship
Define the rate of heat transfer across the thermodynamic system boundary
Calculate energy conversion efficiency
Discuss the effect of energy on environment

learningOutcomes.title: Determine the properties of pure substances and ideal fluids
objectives: Identify phases of pure substances
Illustrate property diagrams for phase change processes
Apply the condition to identify the pure substance as saturated, superheated or subcooled
Explain the concepts of internal energy and enthalpy
Interpret property tables for pure substances
Determine the properties of saturated liquid-vapor mixture, superheated, and subcooled pure substance
Determine properties of liquids
Apply the ideal gas law to solve for pressure, temperature or volume

learningOutcomes.title: Apply the principles of conservation of mass and conservation of energy (first law of thermodynamics) to different types of systems
objectives: Apply the conservation of mass principle to closed and open systems
Calculate the mass flow rate in steady flow systems like nozzles, compressors, turbines, etc
Calculate boundary work using p-v property diagrams
Apply the first law of thermodynamics to a closed system like a piston/cylinder arrangement in spark ignition engines, to solve for power or heat transferred
Apply the first law of thermodynamics to a steady flow systems like a turbine or compressor, nozzle or diffuser, pipes or ducts, to solve for the power and heat transferred
Sketch the work of open and closed systems on pressure-volume property diagrams

learningOutcomes.title: Analyse the various thermodynamic processes on perfect gases and pure substances
objectives: Classify processes of perfect gases and of pure substances
Determine initial and final states of processes
Analyse each process to determine properties and energy involved
Explain the role of processes in thermodynamic cycles/systems

learningOutcomes.title: Analyse heat engine cycles and their thermodynamic efficiency
objectives: Explain the main characteristics of heat engines with graphical illustration
Discuss the second law of thermodynamics
Calculate the thermal efficiency as applied to engine cycle
Calculate entropy for different types of processes
Explain the concept of reversibility and irreversibility as it pertains to the second law
Analyse the Carnot engine and the limits of thermal efficiency
Identify the processes of the Otto and gas turbine cycles and associated thermal efficiencies
Solve for thermal efficiency, compression and expansion work, and engine power

topics: Efficiency, Mass Flow, and The First Law of Thermodynamics
Properties of Pure Substances, Phase Change Processes
Saturation Tables, Super-heated Tables, Linear Interpolation and Equation of State
Conservation of mass and energy, Introduction to Open Systems, Nozzles and Diffusers
